alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 1:13PM MDT until June 05 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Montana... Clear Creek at Chinook affecting Blaine County. For the Clear Creek...including Chinook...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clear Creek at Chinook. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Ranches near Clear Creek starts to get impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM MDT Sunday was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling on Monday. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM MDT.
